# 1. R and RStudio

Please follow the instruction to set up the **most up to date** R and RStudio on desktop: <https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/>

# 2. Install R packages

::: callout-note
Install the packages in the order listed below. The package names are case sensitive.
:::

1.  **Only for windows machines**: Please download and install RTools from <https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/>.
2.  Install the packages listed below **one by one** from CRAN using the `install.packages()` function.

`install.packages("tidyverse")`

`install.packages("Matrix")`

`install.packages("RCurl")`

`install.packages("scales")`

`install.packages("data.table")`

`install.packages("readxl")`

`install.packages("BiocManager")`

`install.packages("ggpubr")`

`install.packages("Seurat")`

2.  Install the packages listed below **one by one** from bioconductor using the `BiocManager::install()` function.

`BiocManager::install("ensembldb")`

`BiocManager::install("org.Hs.eg.db")`

`BiocManager::install("clusterProfiler")`

`BiocManager::install("AnnotationDbi")`

`BiocManager::install("biomaRt")`

`BiocManager::install("enrichplot")`

`BiocManager::install("HGNChelper")`

**Optional**: The materials are updated to Seurat V5. If you want to use `Seurat` V4, you can follow the below instruction to install `Seurat` V4. Please note that you may need to adapt the code to fit `Seurat` V4 structure.

First check the version of installed `SeuratObject` and `Seurat`.

```{r}
packageVersion("SeuratObject")
packageVersion("Seurat")
```

If the version is 5.0.x, please follow the below instructions to remove the existing `Seurat` package and install `Seurat` V4.

```{r}
#| eval: false
remove.packages("SeuratObject")
remove.packages("Seurat")
```

```{r}
#| eval: false
packageurl <- "https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/SeuratObject/SeuratObject_4.1.4.tar.gz" 
install.packages(packageurl, repos=NULL, type="source")
```

```{r}
#| eval: false
packageurl <- "https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/Seurat/Seurat_4.4.0.tar.gz" 
install.packages(packageurl, repos=NULL, type="source")
```

Validate the installation is successful by running `packageVersion.`

```{r}
#| eval: false
packageVersion("SeuratObject")
packageVersion("Seurat")
```

4.  Check that all the packages were installed successfully by loading them **one by one** at a time using the `library()` function.

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(Seurat)
library(BiocManager)
library(Matrix)
library(RCurl)
library(readxl)
library(scales)
library(ggpubr)
library(data.table)
library(AnnotationHub)
library(ensembldb)
library(HGNChelper)
library(clusterProfiler)
library(AnnotationDbi)
library(biomaRt)
library(enrichplot)
```

# 3. Download dataset and code

Please follow the below steps if you would like to run the materials locally.

1.  **Dataset**: Please download the data here: [Data](https://bd-rhapsody-public.s3.amazonaws.com/Rhapsody-Demo-Data/WTA/BD-Demo-WTA-AbSeq-SMK.zip).
2.  **Code**: You will also need to download the entire repository as a .zip from <https://github.com/material-share/material-share-single-cell-boot-camp/tree/master>.

![](pics/1-5-github.png)

After download, unzip the repository and **put the Data folder in the repository**.

3.  To run the analysis, double click on **single-cell-boot-camp.Rproj**. One should be able to bring out the RStudio console on desktop.

If you would like to contribute, report bugs, or suggest any tools or workflow, please open on issue: <https://github.com/material-share/material-share-single-cell-boot-camp/issues>.
